bug.short_desc: the review editor should have a Rebase button

long_desc.thetext: Similar to the web UI the Patch Set section should show a "Review" button for Gerrit 2.4 and later.

Steffen, on Review issue a couple of thoughts here. I could take a look and see if there is something that could be improved relativly simply...would help me get more familiar w/ that API as well.
But that means that we need to have some sense of what the ideal workflow for rebase (at least) would be. My thinking is that it c/should be very simple, to mirror current Web UI:
1. User clicks Rebase. 2. On success, besides task update being trigerred, no other UI is provided. (Perhaps notification to status bar?) 3. On failure, we simply rely on the provided error notification (that might be difficult to disable in any case).
Assuming we can come up with an imporved workflow that makes sense, either:
a) I could submit a patch to the existing Gerrit, or b) we could merge the existing implementation and I could submit under a new Change.

I have submitted the review since it adds the required core functionality (and the awkward UI). Please make concrete suggestions what you intend to change. If we can reach consensus I'd be happy to look at a new change.
Since there hasn't been any further input on the change I consider this resolved.
